Posts.Content: Hi I am nervously waiting for the result of my oncotype dx test to come through. I was diagnosed with breast cancer on the 1st October, 5 weeks after having my daughter. I had found a lump 5 weeks before her due date, which was put down to a blocked milk duct. I was seen on the ward after having my baby and the consultant still thought it was a blocked duct but said he would arrange an appt at the all inclusive breast clinic. 3 weeks later after me chasing it up 5 times, I was given an appt for 2 weeks later - 10 weeks after I first mentioned the lump at the antenatal clinic. If I hadn't been pregnant I would have had to have been checked out within 2 weeks as per NHS guidelines - ridiculous. Though if I hadn't had the delay I wouldn't have had the chance to breastfeed, so am grateful in a way. I had a lumpectomy at the end of October and was advised that I only needed radiotherapy and tablets, however when I went for my oncology appt was thrown a curveball of the oncotype dx test. I was adamant that I didn't want chemo but when advised that if it comes back it could be secondary and might not catch it in time, what's a girl to do...  so am now in the waiting game hoping that it comes back less than 20 (that was our agreed cut-off) and I don't need chemo. I am so frustrated, it took me 19 years to finally become a mum and this time should be all about enjoying my daughter but I have had all this to deal with and while I am fine physically, it is constantly on my mind and I hate not knowing what is going to happen next. I am so worried that I will need chemo and that I will be really ill with it and how will I look after my baby. I hate relying on other people and I have already had to get so much help. I am just trying to be hopeful that when I go next week it will be a low score and I can get the radiotherapy done in January, out the way and I can get on with enjoying my last 4 months maternity leave with my baby. Thanks for reading, just needing a wee rant tonight, helps to just get it out there without upsetting family and friends or them upsetting me with the usual "you'll be fine" Wishing everyone the best Jaki
Posts.Title: Anyone been diagnosed after having a baby
